title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 420.1 - Mortgage loan originator license and revocation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 420.1 - Mortgage loan originator license and revocation

State Regulations
(a) Section
599-c
of the

Banking Law provides that no individual, unless exempt, shall engage in
mortgage loan originating without first obtaining and maintaining a license
from the Superintendent of Financial Services (formerly the Superintendent of

Banks) pursuant to article 12-E of the Banking Law. This regulation implements
the superintendent's authority to license mortgage loan originators. (b) Section
599-n
of the

Banking Law authorizes the superintendent to revoke a license to engage in
mortgage loan originating. In addition, sections 599-i and 599-n set out the
circumstances under which a license will be terminated by operation of
law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
420.1

Adopted, New

York State Register October 1, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 39, eff. 10/1/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
